instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936, Green light but not charge the battery
threads.message:
Hi, i have a macbook pro 820-2936 here.. the macbook power on normaly, with the charger, with battery and without battery. have green light. OSX recognizes the battery and the macbook can power on with a chaged battery. but the osx never seems the charged pluged and the battery never get charged.

here my measures




PPBUS_G3H @ F7040 is 12,53v with and Without bat

CHGR_ACIN 3,44v

CHGR_DCIN 14,07

U7000 Resistance between pin 27/28 : 20 OHMS

U7000 Resistance between pin 17/18: 03.3 OHMS

PP3V42_G3H 3.47




i replaced the u7000 but, same problem.

what do u thing?

threads.title: 820-2936, Green light but not charge the battery
threads.message:
It could be the smc.
Have you measured SDA and SCL to ground?

threads.title: 820-2936, Green light but not charge the battery
threads.message:
i have in diode mode 
SDA 609
SCL 612 .. this measures are at pins of u7000

resistance mode
Open Line (O.L.)

threads.title: 820-2936, Green light but not charge the battery
threads.message: does it say 'plugged in not charging'

threads.title: 820-2936, Green light but not charge the battery
threads.message:
[QUOTE="ALB-Repairs, post: 22564"]does it say 'plugged in not charging'[/QUOTE]

In osx says nothing.. only battery percentage and nothing when i plug the charger..

threads.title: 820-2936, Green light but not charge the battery
threads.message: Have you ruled out a bad battery? Q7055 is also a common issue.

threads.title: 820-2936, Green light but not charge the battery
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 22584"]Have you ruled out a bad battery? Q7055 is also a common issue.[/QUOTE]

Yes duke, i did test with a new battery. so, you suggest to replace the Q7055?

threads.title: 820-2936, Green light but not charge the battery
threads.message:
Duke, at pin 5 of Q7055 have some variables voltages.. i see 12,54v for 5 or 6 segs.. and decrease in 6 segs to 0,95v ... like: 12,54v (for 6 segs) and 7v, 5v, 4v, 2v, 1,5v 0,95v.. (6segs) And 12,54v again!
When the battery is pluged in, have 12,55v stable. but stills having only green light.

With a battery half charged, i have 10v in pins 5,1,2,3 and 3,03v in pin 4.. this is without charger and macbook running.
With battery halft charged and magsafe pluged i have 12,54v at pins 1,2,3,5 and pin 4 have 5v.

what do you thing?

threads.title: 820-2936, Green light but not charge the battery
threads.message: Replace Q7055 to rule that one out.

threads.title: 820-2936, Green light but not charge the battery
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 22616"]Replace Q7055 to rule that one out.[/QUOTE]

I replace it and same thing. with and without the battery i plug the charger and i have green light, orange for a moment.. and again green light and stuck in green.
dont charge the battery.
what do u thing?

threads.title: 820-2936, Green light but not charge the battery
threads.message: Q7080/85 could also cause issues. Check if any of them are shorted.

threads.title: 820-2936, Green light but not charge the battery
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 22649"]Q7080/85 could also cause issues. Check if any of them are shorted.[/QUOTE]

Nope, there are no shorted to ground.

threads.title: 820-2936, Green light but not charge the battery
threads.message: How would this thing work if they had a short to GND. I mean they are short, not to GND. Just replace them....
